metadata.synopsis: Jake (Dylan Walsh) and Betsy (Molly Ringwald) are a young couple looking to tie the knot. Content with an understated, intimate wedding, Jake and Betsy's plans go out the window when Betsy's working-class folks, Eddie (Alan Alda) and Lola (Madeline Kahn), feel compelled to go over the top after they meet Harry and Nancy, Jake's high-class parents. In need of financial help, Eddie enlists a shady in-law (Joe Pesci) for assistance, which only exacerbates matters.

reviews: Most of the people who see this will own funnier home videos of wedding disasters.
Doesn't summon much of a reaction at all, leaving the eventual parade of sentimentality D.O.A. I was entertained by Wedding, but never enlivened by it.
From a bolt of ordinary cloth Alan Alda fashions a thoroughly engaging matrimonial romp.
Betsy's Wedding assembles all of the materials for a human comedy, and then seems unconvinced by them.
